page.title: 19PREGNANCY:MARKET WESTON
page.content: A member of Market Weston WI: When pregnancy has been confirmed, women are advised to visit their doctor or midwife once a month.At l4 weeks into pregnancy a visit is made to the West Suffolk General Hospital in Bury St Edmunds, for an examination by an obstetrician which includes an ultrasound scan (to give a picture of the baby), together with blood & urine tests.Women over 37 years are advised to have a test for abnormalities including Down's Syndrome in the baby and, if necessary, can have the pregnancy terminated. From 32 weeks checks are increased. Most confinements take place in hospital, very few at home. Transport is by car or ambulance. Babies are born naturally,by induction or Caesarian section. Hospitalisation is from 6 hrs to 8 days. After this a midwife visits til baby is l4 days old.
